Dgame.Math.Vector3



struct Vector3(T) if (isNumeric!T);
Vector3 is a structure that defines a two-dimensional point.

Author:
rschuett

T x;
x coordinate

T y;
y coordinate

T z;
z coordinate

pure nothrow this(T x, T y, T z = 0);
CTor

pure nothrow this(U)(U x, U y, U z = 0) if (isNumeric!U && !is(U : T));
CTor

pure nothrow this(U)(U[3] pos) if (isNumeric!U);
CTor

pure nothrow this(U)(ref const Vector3!U vec);
CTor

pure Vector3 opOpAssign(string op)(ref const Vector3 vec);
Supported operation: +=, -=, *=, /= and %=

pure Vector3 opOpAssign(string op)(T number);
Supported operation: +=, -=, *=, /= and %=

pure Vector3 opBinary(string op)(ref const Vector3 vec);
Supported operation: +, -, *, / and %

pure Vector3 opBinary(string op)(T number);
Supported operation: +, -, *, / and %

const pure nothrow Vector3 opNeg();
Returns a negated copy of this Vector.

pure nothrow void negate();
Negate this Vector

const pure nothrow bool opEquals(ref const Vector3 vec);
Compares two vectors by checking whether the coordinates are equals.

const pure nothrow bool isEmpty();
Checks if this vector is empty. This means that his coordinates are 0.

const pure nothrow float scalar(ref const Vector3 vec);
Calculate the scalar product.

alias dot = scalar;
alias for scalar

const pure nothrow float length();
Calculate the length.

const pure nothrow float diff(ref const Vector3 vec);
Calculate the diff between two vectors.

const pure nothrow Vector3 cross(ref const Vector3 vec);
Returns the cross product of this and another Vector.

pure nothrow void set(T x, T y, T z);
Set new coordinates.

pure nothrow void move(T x, T y, T z);
Move the current coordinates.

const pure nothrow T[3] asArray();
Returns the Vector as static array.

alias Vector3s = Vector3!short.Vector3;
Alias for short Vector

alias Vector3f = Vector3!float.Vector3;
Alias for float Vector

alias Vector3b = Vector3!byte.Vector3;
Alias for byte Vector
